	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

"If enabled, embeded links (images etc.) are tested against scope"
 
Readin=
g that I figured that this means that if disabled then embedded links
will =
be scheduled unconditionally (although if recheck of scope is enabled
in th=
e Preselecter they may be discarded there!)
 
However, when I reviewed the =
code I discovered that, yes, if 'true' then
embedded links are treated norm=
ally, but if 'false' embedded links all have
the scheduling directive set t=
o DONT_SCHEDULE which I take to mean that it
will never be crawled. However=
, I can find no evidence that the directive is
supported by the Frontiers w=
hich may lead to some interesting side effects
since the value of the direc=
tive is -1 and generally a lower directive value
is assumed to mean higher =
priority. I would suggest that the boys at the
Archive take a second, much =
closer, look at this.
 
I would further suggest that if we wish to mark URI=
s as 'unschedulable',
this not be done via the scheduling directive, or at =
the very least uses a
value that is higher then NORMAL since most calculati=
ons about scheduling
directives involves simple greater then or less then c=
omparisons of the
integers! (In fact preconditions are (were?) assigned the=
ir parent's
scheduling directive minus one.) Perhaps the entire scheduling =
directive
needs a closer look.
 
I would also suggest that there is general=
ly no need for unconditionally
passing embedded URIs through the scope (if =
that was ever the intention)
since that only muddies up where the scope det=
ermination is performed.
 
- Kris
 
-----Original Message-----
From: archiv=

What exactly does 'sco=
pe-embedded-links' in the LinkScoper do ?
